subject: Creativity
title: The Nocebo Effect: When Imagination Creates Illness
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Nocebo Effect: When Imagination Creates Illness usable.

hook.text: Tell patients a sugar pill has side effects, and 25% will experience them. Imagination creates real physical symptoms.

discovery.text: Reading medication side effects increases the likelihood of experiencing them.

twist.text: In one study, people told they were near a WiFi router reported headaches. The router was switched off.
